There are more than 750,000 one-man concrete bunkers scattered across the countryside, dotting the landscape like giant mutated mushrooms. And former military bases now serve as seaside resorts. --->
Stuffed animals (like Mickey Mouse and Winnie the Pooh) hang from half-completed homes and buildings to ward off evil spirits. --->

In fact, Lazarat is Europe’s largest producer of marijuana. Ever stopped at a café in Amsterdam? Chances are you smoked some of the Lazarati good stuff! Weed production in Lazarat takes in six billion dollars a year, equivalent to about half of Albania’s GDP. I guess that’s why Lazarat is referred to by locals as “Europe’s wealthiest village. --->”
Every Albanian spends half of his day in coffee but in some cases the whole day. In the villages and 50% of the cities are consumers of grape brandy. --->
Today, most of Albanians in Albania do speak Italian and English, and many of them do not consider a luxury knowing foreign languages. --->
Most Albanians who are Muslims do not follow the rules of their religion. For example to eat pork, in this case they enjoy it a lot. --->
